name: Air
description: One of the classical elements. Represents intellect, breath, and spirit.

name: Fire
description: One of the classical elements. Represents energy, will, and transformation.

name: Water
description: One of the classical elements. Represents emotion, intuition, and flow.

name: Earth
description: One of the classical elements. Represents stability, materiality, and foundation.

name: Sphinx
description: A mythical creature with the body of a lion and the head of a human, the sphinx is a guardian figure symbolizing mystery, wisdom, and riddles. In Egypt, it represents royal power and protection; in Greece, it is known for posing challenging questions.

name: Spiral
description: The spiral is an ancient motif found in nature and art, symbolizing growth, evolution, and the journey inward or outward. It often represents cycles, spiritual development, and the unfolding of life.

name: Square
description: The square stands for stability, order, and the material world. Its four equal sides represent balance, the four elements, and the foundation of physical reality.

name: Swan
description: The swan is a symbol of grace, transformation, and the soul‚Äôs journey. Associated with poetry and love, it often represents purity and the connection between the earthly and the divine.

name: Swastika
description: An ancient symbol of good fortune, the swastika represents well-being, prosperity, and the movement of the sun. Its meaning varies across cultures, but it is often linked to cycles, luck, and the eternal.
